intro: [WRONG START] Styrophorum, commonly known as the yellow popleaf, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has palmate leaves that are divided into several lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Stylophorum prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance.
